content.full_text:
Survey for the Sangamon County Commissioners' Court, 2 June 18361 The undersigned, having been appointed to view and locate a road from the county line
               near Watkins mill viaMiller's ferryto the county line in the direction ofPekin, report: that they have made the location and recommend the opening of said road.
               The above is a Plat of said road.2
paragraphs: Survey for the Sangamon County Commissioners' Court, 2 June 18361

The undersigned, having been appointed to view and locate a road from the county line
               near Watkins mill viaMiller's ferryto the county line in the direction ofPekin, report: that they have made the location and recommend the opening of said road.
               The above is a Plat of said road.2

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln authored the entirety of the text on page one, including the signatures
                  of Robert Cownover and William G. Jeter. Page one also includes a survey map in Lincoln’s
                  handwriting, not transcribed here.
2Sometime between June and September, Lincoln authored a petitionrecommendingthat the Sangamon County Commissioners’ Court relocate part of this road.

structured_content.text: Survey for the Sangamon County Commissioners' Court, 2 June 18361

The undersigned, having been appointed to view and locate a road from the county line
               near Watkins mill viaMiller's ferryto the county line in the direction ofPekin, report: that they have made the location and recommend the opening of said road.
               The above is a Plat of said road.2
